Details: Comparison of two Oracle to Snowflake migration Python scripts. Simple_Migration_Script provides basic migration functionality with standard error handling and logging. Comprehensive_Migration_Script offers enterprise-grade solution with advanced validation, detailed reporting, comprehensive error handling, and production-ready features. Both scripts are syntactically correct but differ significantly in scope, robustness, and enterprise readiness.

Both scripts address Oracle to Snowflake migration with stored procedure execution, data export, and validation. Simple_Migration_Script focuses on basic migration workflow while Comprehensive_Migration_Script provides extensive validation, comparison logic, and reporting capabilities. Core intent is aligned but Comprehensive_Migration_Script extends far beyond basic migration to include comprehensive data validation and enterprise features.

Simple_Migration_Script follows linear procedural approach with basic function organization (lines 1-150). Comprehensive_Migration_Script uses modular architecture with clear sections: Configuration (lines 1-50), Utilities (51-80), Connection Components (81-120), Oracle Execution (121-140), Data Export (141-180), Azure Transfer (181-220), External Tables (221-280), Comparison Logic (281-350), Reporting (351-400), Main Execution (401-500). Both follow similar high-level workflow but structural organization differs significantly.

Valid Python syntax throughout. Minor issue: os.system() call on line 45 lacks proper error handling and could fail silently. All imports are standard and properly used. Variable references are consistent. Function definitions are syntactically correct.

Excellent Python syntax and structure. Comprehensive error handling throughout. All imports properly used. Minor consideration: some functions could benefit from additional type hints, but code is production-ready with robust exception handling and logging.

Average of individual scores: (95 + 98) / 2 = 96.5, rounded to 97. Both scripts demonstrate strong syntactic correctness with Comprehensive_Migration_Script showing superior error handling and code organization.
Enhance error handling for os.system() call on line 45. Consider adding more comprehensive logging and validation. Add data comparison features for migration verification.
Excellent enterprise-ready solution. Consider adding type hints for better code documentation. Script demonstrates best practices for production migration scenarios.

For production use, Comprehensive_Migration_Script is recommended due to superior error handling, validation capabilities, and enterprise features. Simple_Migration_Script suitable for basic migration scenarios but requires enhancement for production use.
